info.content:
This year Mummy didn't feel up to hosting the normal gathering. We just had the Elders over which was fun. Joey and Ben played football outside in the dark and playstation. The girls were playing make up, barbies and the like. The adults had a few games to play. We visited Ma Ma and Pop Pop who were over at Grandmas.

New Years Eve Meal

This year we went to see Beauty and the Beast at Camberley Theatre. We almost took a whole row up!

Beauty And The Beast
We joined the gathering at Pete's for the normal fun and games. Daddy came over later by jogging across in the cold, cold weather.

We awoke late in Charlotte's old room, gone 9am! We had breaskfast, cleared up a bit and headed back home.

Later we went over to the Elders for the usual Boxing day gathering.

The cosy room

The krew

Dawg and his new top

Uncle Pete teaching Jess guitar

6am was the limit. Although us children were up earlier than that badgering Mummy and Daddy move the present opening time. We decided this year to move all the presents to Ben's room, at his request. We had 15 each to open and took it in turns. There was some great excitement.

After that we moved into Mummy and Daddy's room to open their presents. They only had 7 each. Mummy got some converse trainers, a new winter jacket and trip to climb the O2. Daddy got the Naked Trader book, some lovely foodstuff, aftershave and a selfie stick.

Next the presents from friends under the tree.

At 9am we went over to the Fars for some breakfast. Mummy and Katie hopped off to the Christmas service at St. Andrews, whilst the rest of us had a rather different game of Coppit. We had a record 10 members in one stack!

After church, at 11am, we headed from the Fars to Gravesend to Ma Ma and Pop Pops. Us children had the main Christmas Meal, then went for a walk to annoy some neighbours by bashing pans and bells to make a hell of a racket. It was a joke aimed at one of Ma ma's friends.

Then we had loads of presents to open.

We played some games before it was time for bed and for the adults to eat their Christmas meal. There was not anything on TV this year to watch.

Pre Opening

Fars Christmas Breakfast

Jess and the Fars

Jess looking beautiful

Katie and Charlotte

Dinner Time

Daddy worked from home in the morning whilst we were getting very excited about Christmas. Katie was really excited and spent a lot of effort making all the Grandparents, aunties and uncles special cards and personal picture DVDs. I think she has as much pleasure giving as receiving presents. Ben was excited for receiving. Jessica was her usual excitable self.

Later in the afternoon we went around to the fars, where we had a treasure hunt around the house. We manage to get the clues and found the Â£15 treasure! After halfway getting through a game of Coppit, Uncle Graham arrived with Susan, so we were able to eat. We had the normal mix of pork and sausages for the evening meal. Auntie Susan won the prize in the riselamange challenge. Then came the dice game..... there was a scrap for a number of items.

Then came the presents. Ben acted as Father Christmas. A lovely time had by all. We left about 9pm.

Mummy went to midnight mass. Katie barely got to sleep she was so excited. I think Father Christmas detected she was awake most of the night, which really worried Katie as she didn't want to appear naughty, thus not getting any presents. Fortunately Father Christmas did arrive and delivered her presents outside her door.

Christmas Time

Ben delivering

Katie's present to Auntie Susan

Ben Marching like Father Christmas

We went for our traditional family meal out with the 5 of us, this year TGI Friday's in Guildford.

The Girls

In the morning, we all went to a big old church in North Camp where Uncle Howard's sort of grandson was being christened. After the service and a cup of tea back at Donita's house, we went home with Elders and later the Sanders came over. Joey and Katie swapped for the night.

This was not one of Ben's best days. I think it was over-excitement, but in the morning he was naughty in refusing to put on a jumper or coat on. We were in a big, cold church. He was mucking around in the church as well. He was told on numerous of occasions to behave. What? What? Was the cheeky response. "You've got one more chance".... "What?", so daddy dragged him over the pew so he could sit next to him. He got upset and grumped off and stood with Uncle Howard for the church service. He did say sorry later, and was friends again.

Then when Joey was around for Sunday dinner, he refused to eat his broccoli, which ended up him getting unreasonable, upset, and used every pedantic trick in the book to absolve all reasoning behind eating it. Stubbornness cost him sitting at the table on his own for 90 minutes or so. Hopefully he has learnt a lesson, not so much about eating broccoli, but more that he cannot get his own way all of the time with smart alec comments.

title.value: Ethan's Christening, Joey - Katie Swap, Sanders and Elders over

info.content:
Daddy collected Ben from Theo's sleepover at his house and went to Woodley parkrun, the 18th different UK parkrun for Ben. It was quite funny as there was a drunk man heckling the parkrun announcements offering everyone rum. He slowly demised and slumped on a park bench asleep. We went around in 27 minutes.

We then rushed back and collected Jessica who was singing with mummy at the old people's homes along St. Catherines Road. She had a party in Camberley at the La Di Da cake shop. It was Roxy's 7th birthday.

Katie had a sleepover at Natasha's.The boys went to visit the Fars whilst waiting for Jessica's party to end.

In the afternoon Ben was to be mascot at the Chertsey Town v Hartley Witney match. He loved it. He trained with the players before hand, was part of the lineup shaking the oppositions hands, and won the toss for Chertsey. However, this did not help the team as they lost 1-0!

In the evening we snuggled up all 5, and watch Elf.

Lineup procedure

Coin toss

title.value: Ben Chertsey Mascot, Woodley parkrun, La Di Da Party

info.content: Even though Mummy does not feel like it, she felt obliged to go to the work Christmas party, as her place had been paid for by the playschool committee. She still does not feel she can feel comfortable socially with Ben's leg issues on her mind.

Mummy took Katie for the Tomlinscote Christmas Carol assembly at her school.

Meanwhile the others went to Ben's cub group and played games. Ben is now a sixer and took the new cubs to be invested with Arkela.

Quiz team

Well I say open house.... family over to see the house. Some have not seen it yet.

Family Gathering

Well we've been gearing up for this for months. Trying to get the house in a state ready for tonight. Well Jessica has engineered an overnight stay at Ma Ma and Pop Pop's, whilst Ben went to Jasper's swimming party and subsequent sleepover.

This year we had boys v girls: Me, Michael, Bazza, Richard, Kelly, Loz and Dawg versus, Laura, Ellie, Julie, Fiona, Joyce and Charlotte. Of course the boys ended the night victorious. We had a mix of games from the traditional titles, mr + mrs, and picture quiz to the more novel top trumps (Dawg). Of course another favourite was the spoons game, this year played with Lego bricks.

Many brought children, who all played upstairs. The Wests, Charlie and Loz stayed over.

The girls team

The boys team

Awful lot of soft drink for a party!

The spoons game

Jessica was an elf in the school Christmas play.

Good elf to ya
Ben has been playing around with Scratch, a beginners programming suite

Daddy friend from FormScape days, Michael Saunders, held a Children's Christmas party in Rownhams Community Centre, near Southampton. It was such a nice idea. We only knew one other, Stuart, again from Daddy's work. However, we played on the bouncy castle and played with the craft, wordsearches, etc.. Then Father Christmas turned up and asked if we were good and what we wanted for Christmas. It was really nice.

Queuing for Father Christmas

The gang

Katie, Ben and Daddy did the parkrun this week, which was nice to see especially as it was freezing out there. Meanwhile Mummy and Jessica joined an army of 20 people to clean the St. Andrews.

Still in the morning we went over to the baptist church as they were doing craft which was nice. Further, we then went on the C of E Christmas Fair where mummy helped on a stall and we bought a few Christmas presents.

In the evening we went to the Balls Christmas Ball. A charity event, organised by James and Duncan which Daddy pitched in and help setup and produce the programme for the evening. It was a great success raising over Â£4000. We loved it as the Elders came and we also played with Freya.

Ellie, Mummy and Daddy

Mummy and Jessica Disco Dancing

The Girls - Not sure what's going on

title.value: Church craft, CoE Fair, Balls Ball

info.content: We left daddy at home whilst we went to church and then over to the Elders to try and see Lily and give her birthday present. Unfortunately she was not in.

Ben spent the weekend at cub camp. He done plenty of cooking on an open fire, made a rope.

Meanwhile Katie had a party in Woking.

In the evening Barrie and Uncle Michael came over and walked over to the Prince Of Wales for a meeting of great minds. It was the Casuals do. Attendees were: Daddy, Michael, Nick, Baz, Gaz and Dave Weaver. Great evening.

Happy Campers

A man walked into the bar....... well two girls and a boy.

New Breakfast Bar

We went over to Hempstead for a 9:30 start at the All Saints church for Guy Morley's christening. Mummy was his godmother. After, we went to their house for some nice food and drink and to case out their wood burning stove. Us kiddies played on the Wi in the back room.

Christening Crew

In the morning Daddy and Ben went to Nonsuch Park near Cheam to do their incredibly muddy parkrun. They managed it in 29 minutes.

They then went straight over to Sandown Park to the Running and Endurance show. There was a mix of trade stands, mainly for energy drinks, running events and selling trainers and clothing. Two interesting bits were the talks upstairs, one a whistle stop to training and everything, the other was a mini triathlon for children. Ben loved it. He got to go on a rowing machine (instead of a swim) and probably the first time he's ever been on a road bike. He loved it. He wants to come back next year!

Meanwhile the girls were out with Ma Ma and Pop Pop all morning and afternoon in Basingstoke shopping. Joy!

Also the carpet man finally arrived to lay Ben's carpet for Â£40. So that meant there was a green light to furnish his room and put his bed together.

This was the first night ever that we each had a bed to sleep in, in our own rooms! Ahhh bliss, although Katie and Ben sleeping together has been very sweet.

Biking at the running show!

title.value: Nonsuch Parkrun, Running Show, Westons Shopping, Ben Bedroom

info.content: Daddy organised a pub trip with the FormScape crew. It was a lovely evening of catch-up.... laughing at/with Dave as usual. Good fun.

After church we immediately went off to Hobbledown, just outside Epsom. We met for the Fars and there was a mixture of animals and play activities for the children. The main bits were the indoor softplay and outdoor playground areas. Included in the outdoor area is a high ropes climbing course. A mini Go-Ape, that Mummy, Farmor, Katie and Ben went on. I think the younger you were the more confident you are!

High Ropes

In the morning we went to Woking Leisure pool. We met with the Elders. Joey joined Daddy and Ben in the parkrun. After Ma Ma and Pop Pop arrived and we all went swimming in the monkey pool, something we haven't done in a while. Daddy gently pushed Jessica around the lazy river 4 times whilst she just floated on her back. I think she would have gone around all day if Daddy was willing!

In the afternoon Ben had a Laser Quest which he done quite well in. It's all the rage for boys his age to havve a LaserQuest party.

Ma Ma and Pop Pop stayed with us all day which was nice, so we could play with them.

After our fish and chip dinner, Ben went for his double MRI scan at Frimley Park hospital. The appointment was for 7:40, which was a strange time on a Saturday evening. The Fars came down as well. After filling in some health questions, Daddy and Ben went in the MRI room. His right knee was wrapped in a load of things, and Ben was slid into the scanning machine. He must have been in there for 30 or 40 minutes. The machine made a hell of a noise at various stages of the process. We were home again by about 8:30pm. Ben was brave and not phased at all. In fact he got a bit border lying there for all that time.

Sweets Handout

title.value: Woking parkrun and swim. Ben Laser Quest party and MRI. Westons over

info.content:
Ben was very embarrassed about having a girlfriend, Erin. Somehow Oliver blurted it out in Mummies earshot. He admitted to it, although said he didn't really say yes and felt too pressured to say no. Her friend asked him. Poor lad.

Anyway 5 days later he was dumped, but it didn't bother him. She dumps everyone apparently.

Ben had the morning off school to go to Frimley Park hospital. The thing where he said one leg is longer than the other has finally ended up seeing a consultant who has XRay-ed him. He said he's seen something on the results but cannot diagnose the problem. So he has referred Ben to have an MRI scan. He also said that he dealt with a similar case last year which was a benign tumour.

title.value: Ben XRay for back of knee

info.content:
In the morning we went to St Andrews for the Remembrance Service. We of course represented the Rainbows, Cubs and Guides. We were also picked out beforehand to all do a reading in the packed church. They all did remarkably well. Jessica wasn't even scared. Well done!

In the afternoon we went over to see Barrie and Julie's house for the first time. It was beautifully decorated. A really nice house. The children all went out to play, and played really well together.

For the most part of this weekend Daddy has been painting the new family room. Paint, Paint, Paint. Well today's painting disaster happened when daddy went down the ladder and put his foot in a big pot of Dulux Brilliant White emulsion paint!! What a plonker!

White Foot

title.value: Remembrance Day Service Reading, Over to Wests

info.content:
In the morning Daddy and Ben went for their regular parkrun at Frimley. This week Joey came along and ran with us, although he had a shoe malfunction so came in at 32 minutes!

We hurried back, Ma Ma and Pop Pop came and picked Ben up to take him to the Reading v Charlton game at the Mad Stadt. Charlton were the victors by 1-0. Frazer formed part of the gaurd of honour on the pitch as part of his boys football team. Ben had a great time and Uncle Matthew said 'Ben was delightful today. Such a lovely young man'.

In the evening, there fortunately was a break in the rain, so we went along with the Fars, Susan and Graham to Ravenscote Fireworks. We were all impressed by them. Back home for soup, but forgot to get sparklers!

Ravenscote Fireworks with Fars
Katie went to Grace's house with the other 2 regulars: Natasha and Nina for a sleepover

title.value: Katie over to Grace's for Sleepover

info.content: Katie and Mummy went down to the Quays to celebrate Grandma's 89th birthday with the rest of the Barnett family.

Daddy, Katie and Ben went to Firecracker at the Arena Raceway, Essex to watch Banger Car racing. It was very muddy.

The Boys putting their feet up

The Robin-ettes

In the morning Daddy went to parkrun and did some more work on decorating the house. Katie's room has been largely done. It's now onto finishing Ben's room. Slate Grey!

The rest of us, left Daddy working, and we went over to Istead Rise to go to the Broadditch Farm Halloween attractions, including the tractor ride. We met with the Elders there.

In the evening we had a McDonalds dinner and stayed over the night.

title.value: Broadditch Farm Halloween, Pop Pop sleepover

info.content: We went to visit the Teale's. Katie slept over with Summer and played 'Teenage Mum's' again! The rest of us slept at Pop Pop's. Daddy was decorating at home again!

Today we went to Birdworld and took Toby with us. In th evening the Elders came over and stayed the night.

Little Penguins

It was half term week. Daddy has taken time off work to decorate the house. We had the pleasure of the Burrows and Morley clan over today. It was nice to see Natasha and Jessica play, and Tom and Ben. They got on really well.

Little Ethan was as good as gold and Helen looked like she had been a mother for years. A natural.

Burrows and Morley Krew

During the extension work, I've painted the new front, side and back of the house a nice Cornish Cream to match the rest of the house. Well so I thought, it matches fine at the front and side, but the rest of the back of the house is a Magnolia colour! Whoops. I painted the back when it was dark, so couldn't really so the difference until the morning.

To the left Cornish Cream, to the right Magnolia

In the afternoon the Wests came over which was nice

Wembley

title.value: Paint House The Wrong Colour, Wests Over

info.content:
Katie went with Leah Sumner and family back down to Lee On Solent for the second time to spend 4 nights away.Katie was so kind, with the Â£15 she was given she spent most of it on holiday presents for the rest of the family!

On the Beach, Lee On Solent

In the morning the Elders came over and joined us in the parkrun. Ben collected his 50 t-shirt and Joey his 10.

In the afternoon we went up to Ipswich, stopping off at a playground in Brentwood en-route, where we met the Fletchers.

This is the first time we'd been to Foxhall Stadium. There were many thousands there. We sat in the Stands and had some local interest in the World Final. Paul Quinnell, who was Daddy's banger car mechanic, had entered his Jaguar. There 60 cars per race. A bit long winded, but an exciting event none the less. Alas, Quinny, went out after 3 laps. A great occasion, although maybe not for the girls next year.

We got home past midnight.

Smash Up
Our girl is growing up. Today, was the discovery of the first zit on the face. It didn't last more than a day though!

Daddy woke on the floor of Martin's house at 6:30am. It's a Sunday and it's so early it is dark outside! What is he doing? Anyway, the weather was good, if a little cold. It was an early start as this was a festival of events. The half marathon started at 8am, and the full marathon at 10am. Along with the Ball brothers, James' cousin, Louise was also running. We were 'running' late and literally arrive at the back of the queue of runners as the start gun went off.

The aim was sub 2 hours, although Daddy was not confident as he hadn't ran many long distances in his training. Nothing above 6 miles! Still it was a beautiful morning, with some real beautiful views of Boscombe and Southbourne. The course was pretty flat. The first real hill was met at 8 miles. At 10 miles things were ok, then running down the hill towards Bournemouth Pier, Daddy went to fast, and suffered within 5 minutes. The Wall! 2 miles of it Miles 10 and 11 were a real struggle and it was lucky that James kindly ran with Daddy to push him on. Fortunately, mile 12, Daddy picked it up again and finished strongly in a time of 1:57.07, a personal best!

He returned to Martyn's house had a nice fry up before returning home. Within 10 minutes of getting home he was out again with the three of us, swimming at the Arena.

All important stats

Cornering with friends

We headed off to Cranleigh on two missions. First, Ben and I were running in the inaugural parkrun. Our claim to fame is that we were the first father and son team past the finish line, about 27 minutes. The girls waited in the car.

After, we looked at laminate flooring which was really fun! NOT. The weather was not great. After lunch we went in to Farnborough for a spot of shopping and to look at lighting, sofas and the like. Sorry kiddies, boring day I know.

Later Daddy left with the Ball brothers and went down to stay at Martyn Ball's for the night in preparation for tomorrows half marathon.
After church, we went over to the Sanders for a spot of tea and a much needed catch up. It's been a while.

An early start. We picked Katie up from her sleepover at Natasha's, before travelling down to Havant where Daddy and Ben decided to do parkruns' 52 and 82. They did in a respectable time considering the course.

After, we all drove down to Porchester Castle. A lovely little village, with nice looking house and a huge castle. We walked around it, went to a nearby playground and finally ate our picnic in the castle grounds. It was lovely.

Castle leaping

Port Solent

Inside the grounds

The extension work is marching on and it was time to start thinking about Katie and Ben's bedrooms. It was hard work to get them to envisage and match furniture up so it all went together. By the end of the trip we were all losing the will too live, so escaped home.

Daddy went over to Michael's for a poker evening, and lost Â£20. Meanwhile, the rest of the Elder crew came to us for a sleepover.

title.value: Walk 64: Porchester Castle, Havant Parkrun, Ikea, Elders Sleepover

info.content:
Katie got a good mark for her literacy work this week, a 5b. She is doing ever so well. There is a lot of fear, fear of detention and of getting into trouble. There is also pride in her work.

Last week she was picked for a 'Ready Steady Cook' challenge and performed on stage in front of her year and won! Better still, she has been voted by her fellow classmates to represent the class on the school council.

Katie has joined the netball club and has started dance classes as well as attending church Youth Club and Guides.We are all very proud of the effort she is making and how well she has settled in to new school life. Well done Katie Chip Chop.

Daddy was up early and decided it was time to get on with decorating the new bathroom. The toilet, bath, sink, wood panelling and tiles were all completed. There were just a few more bits that Mike and Darren had to complete. The main bit of work to be done was the painting. So first the knot protection oil went on the wood panelling, then the paint on the walls. Going for a standard white.

Daddy had been painting the soffits and fascias up by the roof all week, so he was in the painting groove. Both Katie and Jessica helped out, before homework and church interrupted!

In the afternoon we continued with Jessica's DIY swimming lessons. This week we went to Farnborough pool, which was 70% more expensive than Fleet last week. Still we had a lot of space to play and had a great time. Daddy saw how high he could throw us, and how deep we could go in the 3 metre section of the pool.

Another busy weekend in the Gay household. First, Ben had an early start with the cubs catching the coach and boat to Brownsea Island. He was a bit rearfull at first, not sitting near his mates and wanting to be with Mummy and Daddy. Theo turned up and everything turned out fine. He had a great time despite him saying that they did a lot of walking!

Meanwhile, Daddy smashed out his quickest time of the year at parkrun, just sneaking under 23 minutes.

It was Max's wedding and the service was at the grand address of All Souls Church, Langham Place just off Oxford Circus in central London. We only knew one other there. We sat high in the balcony, getting a good view of proceedings. It was a cracking gig. As both Max and Rebecca play in an orchestra, we had a 20 strong orchestral backdrop to the hymms. It was very impressive.

The couple went away for photos, we stopped for tea and cake. However, we knew nobody in the building and the children were getting restless, so we decided to bail, embarrassingly without saying goodbye to anyone.

So to finish the trip in London off, mummy decided we could squeeze the final London Walk out of the book. A 3 miler from St Paul's Cathedral to Convent Garden, via the South Bank and Buckingham Palace. We had seen it all before and we were quite weary of it. It was fun passing South Bank. It is always pretty vibrant there. We rushed to the end as we had to get back and pick Ben from the cub coach.

Max and Rebecca

In All Souls Church

The Sweetie Shop

A bus to match the dress

title.value: Max's Wedding, Walk 63: London Sights, Cubs Brownsea Island

info.content:
Leah wasn't feeling too good in the morning, so she and Natasha returned home before we went off to church. Daddy went around to Farmor's where he learnt to make a Bakewell Tart!

In the early afternoon we went to Stoke Park, Guildford for the Barnett Family Picnic. We had a great time in the paddling pool. We didn't stay that long as we had to go and pick Ben up from cub camp.

Beach Babes

A busy weekend. First Ben was dropped off last night to go for a cub camp in Sunninghill, a purpose built place for them. He had a great time on the climbing wall and earning his axe man's badge! They also had a camp fire and a good old sing song at night fall.

Ben climbing

Daddy went to parkrun on his own that meant, but after met with us and Auntie Susan to watch the Tour Of Britain cycle past. There were loads of police bikes before hand. The stage started in Camberley, so by the time they got to us at the Canal bridge in the village they were still quite compact. Everything was so fast: the motorbikes, the cyclists themselves and then all the support vehicles behind. It was an experience. Auntie Susan came back and joined us in a cup of tea and a nosey at the extension.

We picked Leah up and headed off to Hook for the start of our first Hampshire Walks. It was a 4 miler which looped to the picturesque village of Rotherwick and back. It wasn't the most interesting of walks, other than Rotherwick itself. Daddy and Jessica took plenty of Blackberries along the way. We went straight from the walk to Hart Leisure Centre for our weekly swim. Mummy had forgotten to pack Daddy's swimming trunks!... and add insult to injury, we squirted him right in the face when he wasn't looking on the side lines with one of the pool's super soakers! Oh how we laughed!

Katie and Leah enjoying the walk!!

Jessica the Nutter

Jess Swimming

We returned exhausted, invited Natasha sround to join the sleepover. After a dance show we gave Mummy and Daddy we settled down to watch A Cinderella's Story and Look Who's Talking. We surprisingly didn't stay up too late!

The Show

title.value: Cycling Tour Of Britain, Walk 62: Rotherwick, Leah and Natasha Sleepover, Cub Camp

info.content:
We all went over to Horsham for their inaugural parkrun. It was well attended, plenty of volunteers and involved three laps of the field in the park in the town centre.

Even the girls managed to run 1 mile of it which was nice. Daddy and Ben completed it in a modest 27 minutes. We had a go on the local swings and Daddy chatted to some Frimley Lodge park runners before moving on to a family walk.

Parkrunners

A walk out of the Surrey book today and a break of 4 months. Oh how the children have been let off lightly. At the edge of Dunsfold Aerodrome, where Top Gear is filmed, is Sidney Wood and the site of where the canal which linked the Arun and Wey rivers is situated. It wasn't a long walk.

Picnicers

Mumma and a Dadda

title.value: Horsham PR, Walk 61: Sydney Wood, Dunsfold, Katie and Ben at sleepovers

info.content:
Already the summer holidays are over and it's back to school. Three differrent schools. Jessica in her final year at Sandringham, Ben in year 5 at Frimley C of E and Katie in her first year at Tomlinscote where she is going to meet a lot of new people. Daddy is really anxious for her as he hated starting Tomlinscote.

Natasha came around the girls had already rehearsed the route to school a couple of times.

Three Schools
Nothing too special, although they watched the Jack Reacher film in the evening. 8/10

As Katie had broken her arm, we had postponed her joint party with Natasha until today. About a 14 friends were invited to play in Gravity Zone, which is a big trampolining park. They loved it.

It was also sad it would undoubtedly be the last time Katie would see some of her close friends as they disappear to Collingwood and Kings schools.

The Birthday Crew

title.value: Katie and Natasha's Birthday Party - Gravity Zone

info.content:
For some reason Daddy has accomplished a life long ambition of racing in a proper Banger Car race at Aldershot. For the past couple of weeks he's been going down to the yard to oversee the car.

Loads of friends turned up which was really nice to see. Not sure if they were there hoping to see some proper damage!

Gary came around to pick Daddy up in the morning and they went down the yard to make the finishing touches to the car, namely hover out a load of glass in the driver door and get the number plates to go on the roof ready. Daddy wasn't nervous at all. He just wanted to get in and get on with it.

Final preparations were made to the car at the track, a new brake line for me and new battery for Gaz. We went to the racers briefing which was a waste of time really, only to show what a misery the race directory was. There were junior hot rods there which meant there were 10 year olds with us!

Craned down

The crowds started to arrive. It felt special that so many friends pitched up. Everyone was excited and was having a laugh. Cars all ready, it was time we were on. Having only driven the car 10 yards in the yard and all the mods to the car, I didn't quite know what to expect. How fast could I go around corners? How much impact could it take? What would it feel like? How fast was it all going to be?

The pre race car. Looking sparkling

He's Lush

I'm Slop

RACE 1:

War paint

It was a struggle to get the harness. Luckily dad was about to help. The car stalled if left idle, so I had to keep pumping the accelerator, pushing the clutch in and the brake to slow down. I cautiously went up the pit lane, a left turn and onto the track. I gave it a bit of welly and even did a few handbrake tests when I went around the corner. I still felt pretty calm. Engines off, I heard the announcer call my name. Gaz was a couple of rows ahead of me. It felt such a long time for the control car to slowly pull away. All engines revving to the max. Angry drivers ready to do battle. We slowly crept around, the marshals were waving us frantically to keep close to each other, down the back straight the cars in front, started to really rev and we were off. The first corner successfully negotiated with a slight nudge here and there. Back to start finish straight and now going full speed. I saw Gaz spun out and almost hit the control car! I was still going around the outside. Woooo the speed. There was a lot of jostling and this is when I knew I was in a banger race. The 'jostling' was quite a shock and thought bloody hell. Anyway I went quicker than I thought I would. I really went for it down the next straight and overtook a few cars that were on the inside. It was snooze and lose. However, I should have eased up as I went too wide on the corner however still survived. Lap 2, and I got smashed from behind which took me hurtling towards the corner wall. I slammed on the brakes, but alas, SMASH. The wall! I got smacked again whilst stationary. My car was stationary. This was not going to be fun as I was in a precarious position at the end of the straight with my drivers door exposed to the oncoming cars. In front of me there was a pile up where a car end up on two wheels! I just had to sit there for the rest of the race as my car had no power. I couldn't start the slop-mobil. Gaz however lasted a few more laps than me before he got spun right next to me.

End of race 1. Me and Gaz finish side by side

After the race the car was towed back to the pits and the guys started working on her. The car was 'stretched' back out by use of the crane. The reason I couldn't restart was the power cable had been disconnected. If I had known I could have simply re-attached and gone again. It was nice to speak to friends. They said I didn't look out of place for the little time I was out on track.

RACE 2:

Patched up and out again. Same tactics. Thought if I could survive a few laps I might do alright, and how right I was. The race settled down and I followed Gaz around for a number of laps. I could have taken him out, but wanted to make sure I didn't wreck his car. Wanted him to able to get in a full race. We duelled I eventually finished ahead of him and slowed for the chequered flag. However, that was for the winners, we were at least a lap behind, but I had slowed for the end of the race. Gaz launched himself into me down the back straight. Wallop. Brilliant. We both finished the race, although my result hadn't gone through officially.

Gaz has got me

Gaz leaves me!

Switch on the 'game face'

Gaz following me around

Gazza's two footed challenge into my door.

Screaching tyres

The dynamic duo, racing for position

A gent following a car wrecker!

Oh yeah baby. Another one bites the dust

Tyre smoke. Yeahh.

Gaz following me

RACE 3:

As we had both finished there was not much work to be done in the pits. There was quite a number of races until we had our third and final race: Nudge and Spin. Which sounds gentle enough doesn't it? But what it basically means is you have to hit someone in order to pass them, no hit, no pass! A dumbed down version of a DD! Out we go again and I was still bouncing around as if my wheels were oval shaped and rubbed up against the wheel arch. I tried to push start Gaz, but unfortunately his car was not having any of it, and so had to retire before the race had even started. This time I lined up on the grid near the back. A good place to be. The control car peels off and almost instantly I get a heavy whack from behind on the home straight! Loved it. The next few laps were bumpy, I nudge one or two out of the way, then about Lap 5 there was a car ahead going half the speed of me, so wallop I give him the biggest hit I could muster square on the back side! Love it. It felt pretty strong, but I think at the same time someone was behind me, so in effect I was the meat in a sandwich! My car was wrecked, back and front. The other cars got away. Just leaving me. After the initial shock, I tried to get the slop-mobil going again. It wasn't looking good. Then a glimmer of hope, I could hear the engine turning over trying to start. It sounded as if it were drowning. The engine was overheating and steam was emanating from the bonnet. Just as the slop-mobil was going to start. SMASH. Someone hit me hard from behind and by all accounts there was no one else around they took a long run up down the straight and headed square for me! I wasn't even on the track!

Again a little dazed. I went back to work at starting her up. Success! Woo Hoo. I thought back in the game. Then my heart sank, the car wouldn't move. I tried revving really hard both in forward and backwards gears. Steam was billowing out of the car. Katie was sobbing her eyes out. Mummy was urging me to get out of the car as she thought it was going to blow up!! 12 laps into the race, I resigned to the fact the slop-mobil was dead. Time to dice with death and get out of the car before I was targeted again. There was a gap, so unharnessed myself and ran into the middle of the track and watched the last laps with Gaz.

Looks like I'm gonna take him out

Aaarghh. I don't have him

Taking the slop-mobil to the max

Into the door

In the mix. Just after a big hit. The predators leave there dead pray behind

Anyone got a spare boot?

The final result

Trying to get her started again

POST RACING

Race over and I went to inspect the car. It was a mess. Thank goodness for the A Frame and the driver door panels otherwise I would be a gonna. Three of the wheels were wedged against the chassis of the car. There was no chance of that car moving. It was a write off. Gaz managed to get us on the control car for the winners parade lap. Brilliant. Mark Pope, the winner, said he'd never been cheered so much. There certainly was a lot of support for us. The car was fork lifted back to the pits and loaded straight on to the transporter. Thanks have to go to the pit crew. Some off which just seemed to turn up and help out. Great community. Special thanks to Russel and Paul Quinnell. Talents, no doubt.

My car is forked

Enjoying the patrol car lap

Saluting the fans

Me and my slop-mobil

We packed up, went back to the yard, then we went down the Swan in Ash Vale to buy the pit crew and their families a drink. We were trying to persuade Gary to participate next week!!

Definitely a great day, not just for the racing, but felt touched at all the friends and family who came to support us.

Friends who came to watch

Ben was to complete his 50th parkrun today, which is an immense achievement. He's done so well considering the injury he has, and still yet to be sorted by the NHS. We laughed at first at the notion of one leg being shorter than the other, but essentially it gives him a bit of grief. Still Ben, is eager to boulder on and loves the fact a fuss is being made over it.

Max and his soon to be wife has come down from London especially, the Fars had also made an appearance. Ben's name was read out in the notices and the 300 people there all clapped him. He had a big grin on his chops!

The run itself was quite unremarkable, 27 minutes, but James sprung a triple chocolate cake and we all shared it amongst the pr community.

We then headed down to the canal centre and we tucked into Grandma's cake. There was a good lot of us there.

Jessica was invited to Imogen's birthday party at the new Gravity Force, trampolining centre. She had a great time there!

In the afternoon we met with Gary, Reece, Kien and the Elders to paint the banger cars.... and boy did we do a good job. It was children only, and I don't think there has been a car decorated like it before! We made a right mess of the car, the yard and of ourselves!

We had a sleepover swap. Lily came to stay with us for a night, whilst Ben stayed at the Elders.

Cake!
This week, for the whole week we went to church club which we all really enjoyed. Mummy came to help as an assistant.
Thanks to Daddy we had to do the Ice Bucket Challenge!

title.value: Ice Bucket Challenge - The Rest Of Us

info.content: A miserable day weather-wise, met with a fitting end for Daddy in the current viral date, the Ice Bucket Challenge.

After church Grandma came over for Sunday lunch. Daddy had BBQ a large joint of pork for 6 hours! Delicious.

Later in the afternoon Steve and Eva came over. Istead of playing loads of Uno, Eva loved a spot of 'Guess Who'.

title.value: Great Gradma Sunday Lunch - Barnett's Pop By

info.content:
After parkrun we went to watch the big match, Frimley Green v Chertsey Town. Now Chertsey should really be beating teams like Frimley Green. Ben and Daddy were there from the start. Daddy was so embarrassing. Frimley Green had a penalty and we happened to be standing behind the goal. Daddy started to jump around like a monkey and made lots of strange noises..... and it worked. Frimley Green missed the chance going 1-0 up. Ben was so embarrassed. Still it was not to be the last time, as his grandfather decided to barrack the referee very loudly and quite often.... as well as the Chertsey players. It ended 3-2 to Frimley Green thanks to their last minute winner. Everyone other than Daddy and Farfar were pleased with the result!

Meanwhile Katie was at Nina's house for a sleepover with the Gang of Four.

title.value: Frimley Green v Chertsey, Katie Sleepover

info.content:
Just over a week away now till the banger meet. The car is being preped currently. Daddy went down the yard and helped a bit.... a very tiny bit. Apparently it's taken 12 hours to strip the car.

Natasha came for a sleep over.

Big Steering Wheel

Banger Banner
The Fars treated us and went to Robin Hill park on the Isle Of Wight. We had a great time, highlight was the toboggan run.
We went with Mummy and Katie's friends: Natasha, Nine and Grace. We had a great time.

It was with great sadness to hear that Uncle Ron had passed away this morning. Daddy and the Fars had gone to see him last night, and he was not in a good way. He died this morning, with Maureen at his bed side. It is very sad, but he is in a better place now.

In the afternoon we went for a bike ride along the Blackwater River and Basingstoke Canal

Basingstoke Canal

title.value: Uncle Ron Gay Passes Away + Bike Ride

info.content: We returned from a weeks holiday in Devon.

We went to Tunnel's beach, a private affair. Daddy and Michael decided to kayak there. Luckily they did not take Ben as Daddy had wanted as the swell was huge. The boys had fun. When the tide went out the sea turned into a swimming baths and we all got in.

In the evening we took some family shots before Daddy and the Elder departed.

Kayaking from Hele beach

Rock stars

The girls

The boys

Us Kiddies

All Of Us

Today we spent the day at Woolacoombe beach. Daddy cycled there whilst we paid the extortionate car parking prices.

The Boys mud pit

Hubba Bubba Mumma

We went into Ilfracoombe and played Crazy Golf in the morning and had a go in the arcades.

Wild Girls

In the evening a few of us went for a walk to Watermouth Harbour and back again.

Don't fall ladies

title.value: Little Meadows Holiday: Crazy Golf - Watermouth

info.content:
We went to Ilfracoombe harbour to get some very tasty fish and chips. Earlier we had gone to Coombe Martin for a spot of kayaking and a play on the beach.

Look behind you Jess

Hele Bay today

Walking to Hele Bay

Today the weather was awful. We played in the campsite and walked down to Watermouth

Watermouth
Camp Setup

Ben has reached the mighty age of 9. He received lots of money as presents. He also got Now 88 CD. Daddy took the day off to spend with us, but we went over to Paula's and played with Robert over there.

In the afternoon we went to Aldershot Ski slope and did Xbob-ing for an hour or so. Ben had 8 friends. After we went to Burger King and had a meal. Mummy remarked how much easier it all was.

XBobing

High Spirits - Birthday Meal

We got home to open some of the presents given my Ben's friends. He got more money, a Man Utd shirt. He is very lucky. Auntie Susan also popped over and gave a present.

Uncle Ron has been taken to hospital. He has had a number of falls and has been unwell at home for a number of weeks. He is barely eating and not keeping himself too well. The Fars have been over a number of times to make sure he is ok, cleaning the house, sorting the garden and other things.

At first he has got an infection, but now it is far more serious and now has lung cancer. The outlook is not good. He is in Stoke Mandeville hospital.

Sadly our last day and the unknown Hidden Valley. Good reviews on Trip Advisor, but difficult to know what they are actually offering. Well chiefly two treasure hunts, a Crystal maze type puzzle, a wacky house and a small train ride.

  • Costs:
  • Petrol: Â£153
  • Food: Â£173
  • Hotels: Â£419
  • Hidden Valley: Â£37
  • Ships And Castles:Â£28
  • Flambards: Â£63
  • Adrenaline Quarry: Â£90
  • Tintagel Castle: Â£19
  • Bowood: Â£41

TOTAL: Â£1023

Daddy looked up where the local parkrun was. Result Lanhydrock was just 3 miles down the road, so he persuaded Ben to join him on the toughest parkrun ever! The plan was to take it easy, but by the end there was plenty of encouragement to complete the course. Daddy was very proud at the mental toughness and stamina that Ben exhibited. He got plenty of well done's from fellow park runners.

They rushed back to collect the others and then headed to Adrenaline Quarry where we met the Elders. Adrenaline Quarry has a massive zip wire, 490 metres long and 50 metres high, which you reach a speed of 45 mph and a swing which you hang over the quarry!

Look for yourself at video's of the 'experience'. Needless to say, Katie was terrified. Ben and Jessica were loving it.

We then moved to the bottom of the quarry where you were allowed to picnic and swim. We had a great time. So nice to play with the Elders. We played football with others that were there. Alas, it was time say goodbye to the Elders and we moved on to Looe.

We wandered around the town, had an ice cream as we hung over the river wall. There was a lovely holiday feel to the place.

Next stop, was the next village along the coast, Polperro. We didn't stop as the only place to park meant paying an all day fee. We only wanted to be there for 30 mins or so. So we drove embarrassingly down the main drag. I think this is where daddy knock an old man over the last time he came here. Fortunately no such repeat performances. Another picturesque village.

This evening's destination was Saltash which does not have a chip shop! Scandalous. However, it does have a good park, with nice views.

From Truro we went back west again. This time Falmouth and the unimpressive, but expensive Ships and Castles swimming pool. They had a stupid system which meant we had to wait 45 minutes, then the slides had broken, it was crowded and old. Anyway that was Daddy's view. We had a great time.

It was the worst day weather-wise. It rained on and off. We headed to Perranuthnoe, near Penzance, dumped the car and went for a walk to St Michael's Mount, an island at high tide, but not at low tide. We took the costal path which lead us on to the beach, then a treacherous passage over rocks in the sea. This was too much, so Mummy and Jessica returned to the car and drove around. Meanwhile the rest of us climbed up a steep, high bank to re-join the path. It was quite exciting. An adventure. Not quite mirroring the Famous Five mummy had been reading the car, but nevertheless, we were not sure if it was possible or if it lead to a path to the St Michael's Mount. Fortunately it did.

We had a good time playing about on the rocks and view the impressive island. Then the heavens decided to open once more, very heavily. We took cover, returned back to shore.

Bad Girls

Tip toeing over the cobbles at St Michael's Mount

Daddy then decided to go off piste, and we headed towards Lands End. Knowing it wasn't great there, we just went to say we've been there. A tick in the box.

From there we had the long drive back up to Bodmin where we stayed the night.

Lands End

title.value: Cornwall 2014: Ships and Castles, St Michael's Mount, Lands End

info.content:
We first tried to visit Godrevy Beach, a place where we were recommended to go to see seals. However, our intention was to quickly pop in, but hadn't realized it would cost us a fiver. So we headed towards Helston and Flambards. I say headed towards. We didn't reach it for a long time. The traffic was horrendous because of the airshow at the airstrip right next to the theme park! Arrghh. We eventually got there and got in. It was a race to the first ride.

Flambards was a strange old place. Small and old and a bit run down. It had a certain old charm to the place. Anyway there were not that many people in, so the queues were short. Which meant we had a go on everything, at least once. The log flume proved popular. Must have gone on that about 10 times through out the day.

We did loads, highlights were the dual karts which Jessica went on, the enterprise type ride, which Ben loved and the science tent which was different, in a good way.

Fatty Family

Water Flume Ride

Going down

Formula 1

We stayed right to the end, which was only about 5pm. We had the long-ish journey to Truro. Another Premier Inn. We headed into town for another Weatherspoon's meal. We didn't explore Truro, we were shattered and turned in for the night.

We had a late-ish start to the day and began by going to the local nature trail place, Cardinham Woods. The playground was a little disappointing for the size of the park so we quickly moved on to a 2 or 3 mile walk along the stream. Ben's intent I think was to worry Mummy by climbing the high banks. Some took an effort, and of course the others wanted to follow. We had fun.

Katie decided now was the time to get rid of the cast around her arm. It was a soft cast that the doctor said we could cut when we saw fit. At first, Katie said she preferred the cast on and felt weird when it was off.

We left Cardinham Woods and headed off to Newquay and hit the beach. Daddy was called a smurf-ette because he refused to go into the sea as there was no dry towel for him. Ahhhhhh. Poor Daddy. The rest of us didn't let that bother us and jump straight in..... when we walked the 500m to the sea. Tide was out.

The Big Build project was underway. Daddy and Ben dug down till they hit water and then created a large pond. Good fun, with not much of an end product. Hey Ho.

Daddy and Jessica visited a few surf shops before heading off again. Destination: St. Ives.

We parked at the top of town. Literally at the top, and walked down into a lovely Cornish town. The sun was out, we were treated to ice creams and we hit the beach and played boul, catch and bat and ball. It was a lovely atmosphere. A place we all loved. We ate in town before returning up the steep hills to the car. We spent a lot more time here than we expected just because we loved it.

It was getting dark and late so headed this time to a Premier Inn. Our first ever. As a visitor to many Travelodge's we noticed a slight upgrade in quality. For one, we had air conditioning, which was much needed in the hot, sultry conditions.

Ben and Jess in St Ives

Jess Bat and Ball queen

Stylish Kate

Princess Katie playing on the beach

Ice Creams all round

Jessica Suef shopping

Newquay quarry

Jessica - Cardinham Woods

Running Mad

Jess taking photos

title.value: Conwall 2014: Cardinham Woods, Newquay, St Ives

info.content:
Daddy went the wrong way to Tintagel so we arrived a little later than expected. First stop lunch and Mummy was desperate for a Cornish Pasty. Fortunately she had come to the right place.

We took the walk down to the castle, or what is left of it. There were some medieval fighting demonstrations in a really picturesque setting. Ben entered the sword fighting championships and won, twice! He was immensely proud, and rightly so. His tactics were spot on. Most would fight 1 v1. He just went around stabbing people in the back as they were busy fighting others. Good work Ben. The scenery was stunning.

We left Daddy to explore the area up on the cliffs whilst we went down to the beach part..... and we got in and climbed the rock which protruded from the sea. Brave, as it was freezing cold.

Champion taking on all comers

Tintagel rock

Tintagel coastline

A hot honey!

Tintagel steps

Playing in the water

This year we sort of decided the holiday destination with a family sale and vote. In one of the Come Dine With Me's, we all presented our holiday idea and then we all voted. I think the Scotland and Northern Ireland ideas came 1st and 2nd, but ruled out due to cost, therefore we went with Katie's West Country holiday.

It was raining when we left early, but it soon cleared and by the time we reached Bowood it was baking hot and sunny. We'd been recommended Bowood by a few, for the adventure playground mainly.... and yes the Death Slide was the first main draw. Ben won the 'bravery' award for going down first. Jessica was a little nervous, but was quick to go down. Katie still had her arm in plaster, so was in internal turmoil. She desperately wanted to go down, but felt she couldn't. It took many failed attempts of sitting on the edge before she eventually took the plunge. Daddy sat at the top and didn't think he could do it. One of those funny things, you know it's OK, and once you've done it, all subsequent turns would be fine.

Death slide champion

We played on the swings, had our picnic, then went for a walk around the house and grounds. It was a scorching day by now. Jessica remarked to the whole stately home how one of the statues had a willy!!! Thanks Jessica for that. She found it very amusing. The grounds were lovely. A picturesque hill down to the lake and a path which runs to a hidden waterfall which we all had a play in. Katie wanted to protect her arm from the water so put a shopping bag around her arm. Must have looked a little strange to passers by. Anyway the waterfall was great as we could hide behind the tumbling water. Behind that were some unlit caves which were a bit eerie to walk around. We got a family mug shot overlooking the lake and house. Lovely.

Look at those straight legs

Bowood Lawn Rolling

Bowood Waterfall

So what you going to wear for the rest of the day?

Family Mug Shot

Taxi for Master Gay

We returned back for some more play, then headed off late afternoon to Tiverton where we stopped at the River Exe and had Fish and Chips before turning into our nearby Travelodge for the night.

• Morning All - Many not getting a huge amount of sleep again. The times still remained on average under the hour. The team had bought themselves 45 minutes. Good work! We all ran 1 lap in the dark. The Solo-ists were still going around. Amazing. We all made sure we gave a 'well done' as we passed them.
  • 3rd Leg - The Sunday morning legs were run in perfect conditions. The crowds came back to support and cheer us on, it wasn't too hot, it was light and dry. Muscles still ached but we were all fit to go again.
  • Run, Eat and Repeat - They had completed 2 laps more than us, but the wheels had come off. Jen, Phil and Alex were crocked, Tom was exhausted having no sleep, Mark had already ran 40km and the bionic man of David Peddle never knew when he was beat! 20 minutes before his leg, he was cramping badly. How he managed 50km was anyone's guess. They still managed 25 laps in total
  • Lap 4 - Everything went to plan. The whole team came to greet Sarah in after her 3rd lap, an exchange of banter, and as a team we were all off again, this time at walking pace..... and carrying a clanging money bucket. James' inspired thought which earned another Â£80 for the cause. TR24 competitors and spectators were so supportive. As we trotted (at best) around we swapped stories of near misses, worst hill, best view experiences. The final 1km was truly hair raising. The supporting crowds cheered, the 'Run Eat' team joined us as sprinted up the last hill which didn't seem so bad after all. We linked arms and crossed the finish line, lap 25, as one. A very fitting and emotional finish.
  • Medals and Photos - .... and more photos. We collected our well deserved medals and posed for photos. James wanted every combination possible.... and of course the jump shot!
  • Exhausted and Elated - We packed up, said our goodbyes, swapped details with our new TR24 friends, struggled home then went our separate ways. Back to normal life again. What a weekend.

• Bonkers To Do Conkers - Most of the team decided 40km was not enough, so went to the local Conkers parkrun to run a slow one! Far from a training run, it was a tad hot, a few hills on the course and we still managed a respectable 28 minutes. Then a 10 mile search for petroleum. We managed to catch a glimpse of the terrifying course at 1km. Are we hill climbing?
  • Race Briefing - At 11:30am we could see all the competitors at the race briefing. There were the brave solo runners, fancy dress runners, casual runners, serious running clubs and charity runners. The excitement and atmosphere were building.
  • And They're Off... - Captain Duncan was our lead off man. We rushed back to base, about 2km into the circuit. We all cheered loudly and gave high fives as he ran past. 56 minutes later the snap band got passed to Richard to start leg 2. We all waited anxiously for the course report. It was tough, bloody tough: Hills, ruts, tree stumps, single paths and possibly the worst thing was the 28 degree heat! Despite all that Dunc managed a sub 1 hour lap which was good.
  • Team Support - We had a good process going, we cheered each runner as they passed us at 2km, we had a good hand over strategy and were one of the only teams to have someone to meet and greet with a drink and a pat on the back for the runner just finishing their lap.
  • Everyone's Lap 1 completed - After Dunc we had coach Richard, speedy Chris who hadn't ran 10km for months, super fit Lee, a nervous Martin who tried a 10km the week before and broke down, then Nick who was secretly competing to do the quickest time, James who also went out with all guns blazing and then finally Sarah who had to wait an agonising 6.5 hours.
  • Darkness Descends - The temperatures had finally cooled, but the next challenge to take it's place was darkness. Not only that, we had a couple of showers to add to the mix. Nervous laughter echoed around camp FF. Many of the team were running in the dark for the first time. The head torches; a new toy. Most of us turned an ankle at the wooded section at 7km or slipped along the grassy sections. Another challenge, another bit of excitement. We all came through unscathed thankfully.

• Packing - Are you sure we're going for 2.5 days? Or is it 2.5 weeks? Chris's large estate car was rammed to the roof with tents and luggage!
  • Journey - Convoy begins setting off at 10am. Not a bad journey, just over 2 hours.
  • Pitch - Shocked to see that you cordoned off an area for your team. We arrived 1 hour after opening and already running out of space. Still we got a pitch at a prime spot, next to the course.
  • Tent Making - The Ball brothers attempts at putting up their two man tent. Chuckle Brothers!
  • Team Arrives - By early evening the whole team has arrived, tents set, sun shining, chilling out with a DoomBar and some good food (Chef Yewings)
  • Pyjama Run - Our chief cheerleaders, Farah Lilly and Ethan, entered the junior 750m race with about 100 participants. Ethan came 3rd overall, and Farah Lilly first girl. Great running
  • Tented Village - We cased out the tented village - the Adidas shop and collected the prized sky blue, TR24 shirts.
  • Lists - Chris, the self appointed list maker, listed the runners with their expected start times. We budgeted for an hour each.
  • Sister Team - Frimley Lodge supplied a number of runners to the quick 'Run Eat And Repeat' sister team. They supported and joined us in the FF gazebo. What a nice set of people they were: Jen, Tom, Mark, David, Alex and Phil.
  • Lights Out - We tried to get an early night. I think we were all in bed by 11:30pm. Some getting virtually no sleep, some a good 7 hours!

Because Katie had broken her arm, we postponed her birthday party till a later date. Instead the Elders came over and Daddy made a great treasure hunt, which had two treasure maps, clues that needed to use the camera, computer, walk to Gradma's and the Fars

In the morning Daddy took Jessica over to Ash Vale, by Gold Valley and dunked in the kayak on the Basingstoke Canal. Jessica loved the fact she had some special time with Daddy, more than the kayaking itself, although she did make a good effort. She did also wonder when she could tuck into the fruit that we had brought along with us!

They headed south for about 45 minutes, turned around and came back again. They had a nice time.

After lunch Mummy went off to Gatwick airport to pick Charlotte up from her holiday in Greece. It took ages, as someone tried running across a busy roundabout and got a bit squashed, so all the roads were jammed. Charlotte had a nice time and went with Loz.

We picked Ben up from cub camp. He had a great time and won the rocket competition which he was especially happy about.

We had a nice roast Chicken for dinner. First for a while. Lovely.

Jessica in kayak action

title.value: Jessica Kayaking, Chaz Airport Pickup, Failed 10km

info.content:
Packed day starting with Daddy's fastest parkrun of the year, 22:50. He was well pleased with his performance. Last parkrun before the big ThunderRun meet next weekend.

Both sets of grandparents came along to watch Jessica's Liberty Gym display at Farnborough Leisure Centre. Everyone was impressed at both the general standard of skill and how accomplished Jessica was. It went on for 2 hours. In that time Jessica performed on the high beam, on the horse, springboard, but mainly on the dance mat. She loved it.

Ben went to the Farnborough airshow with the cubs. It was a scorching day. His best bit was seeing the TomCat fighter jet, as that was the loudest thing there. Ben could reel off all the planes he saw.

Katie was picked up from her sleepover at Emily's and along with Mummy went to her relatives on the West side for a BBQ. Katie fell asleep having been up all night.

Hope you are following this.... meanwhile Daddy and Jessica were at St Georges playing fields watching the airshow with Uncle Steven and Eva. They both played very well together, constantly holding hands and hugging each other. They weren't that interested in the planes like the boys were. They came back as it was getting too hot, for some sun cream and refreshments. They watched the Red Arrows from the back garden.

Katie was dropped off at Natasha's for another sleepover with Grace and Nina. Katie only lasted till 8:30pm!

Mummy, Daddy and Jessica went over to the Elders and saw the Elders for a bit. Jessica stayed and went with them to a local campsite to meet their friends. Jessica played well with new children. She kept going on about a game called '7 minutes'. Sounded like a load of exercising to me! Daddy and Mummy went off for a birthday meal at the Sun pub in Binstead.

What a busy day.

Ice Creams all round

Tuck off the beam

Squat

I heart you!

Star performer

Lapping the crowd

title.value: Jessica Liberty Gym, Fboro Airshow, Elizabth BBQ, Party, Mummy and Daddy meal out

info.content:
Katie went over to Emily's for a sleepover. Liam, Emma Tyas and Emily's twin brother were there to. Katie stayed up all night. Yep, didn't go to sleep at all. She had a great time and was buzzing about the sleep over.

Ben was away for the weekend with the cubs. They camped in the cub compound on the Friday night.

Jessica had sports day and competed in a number of events. Her yellow team won!

Meanwhile, the responsible mother of 3 went out with her fellow teachers and got completely smashed. When she returned at 1:30am, she fell out of bed, was sick and fell asleep on the toilet floor. Not a pretty site!

Chucking the welly

title.value: Emily K sleepover, Ben Cub Camp, Jessica Sports Day, Mummy very drunk!

info.content:
Katie had a small part in this years school play.

Katie as Bob the Builder in Robin Hood

Finally the time has come for the extension work to begin. First job is bring in the artillery and make holes.

Digger mad

Today was the day we got reports back from Jessica, Ben and Katie's SATs results.

  • Jessica: There were some cracking lines in the report. 'Knows when to behave' and the teacher remarking 'that he should check through his work'..... yes the teacher saying 'he' and 'his' on that sentence!!
  • Ben: Another commendable set of results. You could not hope for a better set of results in terms of attitude, effort, behaviour and attainment. The only blip being art. He has his parents to blame for a lack of skills in this area.
  • Katie: SATs results. Bearing in mind a level 4 is considered the standard she should be at. A level 3 is below par. In each of the three tests Katie attained a 5!! Yes a 5. It even surpassed the teacher's expected grades which is even better and a credit to the hard work that she has put in. The comments on her report were equally as glowing.

All three reports have made both Mummy and Daddy exceptionally proud. Well done kidos.

We swapped Joey and Jessica around with the Elders.

Another year, another carnival. At least we hadn't need to travel that far this year. Jessica was on the Liberty gymnastics float, whilst Ben went on as an English knight on the George and the dragon themed float.

Mummy helped on the Pre School stall. Jessica performed in the parade ring her gymnastics routine. She looked so content and at home performing in front of all the people. She loved it/

In the evening Daddy watched the World Cup final.

Jessa Ladybird

Katie, Leah, Natasha watching Jessica's show

Jessica liberty

Jessica performing

In the morning Daddy went to do the parkurn. Ben went with the cubs to the Cody Technology Park where he was able to go on plane and car simulators. He had a great time.

Meanwhile, Katie went to Emma's 11th birthday party. It was a horse riding party. Normally a fantastic oppotunity, but with a broken arm a little hard to participate. Much to our amazement she still managed to get a go on a horse, groom and help tack and all that. She had a great time.

After she went straight over to Leah's for a sleepover. She ended up in the Frimley Green Working Mens club and was able to select a dozen or so songs from jukebox. When they got home they had a disco!

Since coming back from Leah's Katie has put pressure on getting a mobile phone.

In the evening we met for a Barnett meal at the Star in Leatherhead, this time to celebrate Uncle Philip's birthday.

title.value: Emma's 11th Birthday Party, Leah sleepover, Farnborough Cody Technology Park, Philip's Birthday Meal

info.content:
As part of Thunder Run training, Daddy decided to attempt a simulation of the event, running 40km in a little under 24 hours. Therefore here is the low down on the runs:

  • 12:10pm - 11km - Work run. I got lost a bit thus making it an extended run. It was quite hot and hilly. It certainly was a tough opener and the legs felt tired afterwards.
  • 7:40pm - 12km - Red Road Roundabout circular. This started off tough. My calves were not loving the second long run at first. However, after a mile or so, I got in to the swing of things. Managed to get around in about 1:03hrs.
  • 5:00am - 12km - Red Road Roundabout circular. Got up at 3am to eat some porridge in preparation. It was lovely to be running when the street lights were pinging off one by one and nobody about. The odd car past, but it was nice to run in the middle of normally busy roads! However, after about the 30km mark I became quite dizzy and couldn't shake it off. Therefore I had to stop and walk for a bit. I tried to go again a minute later, alas no good. Repeat this 4 or 5 times. After about 5 minutes I was OK again to run, extending my time by about 5 minutes or so. Got home just after 6am, and went to bed.
  • 9:00am - 5km - parkrun. Ben did not join me. I started off slow, but quickened up to finish in just under 29 minutes. I lasted the distance well. Very proud of myself and a great confidence booster.

I had to sleep for 4 hours during Saturday and didn't feel like doing too much for the rest of the day.

We helped Daddy open his cards and presents in bed as usual, along with the traditional croissants. Daddy got: running magazine, some cherries, raspberries, a meal out with mummy, Jessica's self portrait and some craft from Katie.

In the evening Susan, Graham and the Fars came around for another round of presents. Lovely

Jessica Portrait

Katie was worried that she was pregnant because she was feeling sick and thought she was getting fat! Mummy said you had a to sleep with a boy to get pregnant, to which Katie replied, I sleep with Ben. At this point, Mummy sat Katie down and went through a few things. Katie asked a couple of questions at the end.

Next week she has a Sex Ed class. Daddy was sad. Where has my little Katie gone! He wants her to stop growing up!

Ellie and Lily stayed over the night, they left early. Daddy began the first of his two 11.75km runs. All training for the Thunder Run 24, in 3 weeks time. He was well pleased he managed to last the distance on both of these. The route took him to the Red Road roundabout at it's furthest point!

Jessica had a birthday party at the Mytchett Centre at 11. Mummy had forgotten that church had changed times this week, so we missed it.

Daddy was recovering from the first run, and a bad nights sleep. He spent most of the late morning and early morning comotosing on the bad and sofa, watch the Tour De France, British Grand Prix and Men's Wimbledon final. A feast of British sport.

Kaite and Mummy went into Camberley for some clothes shopping. Funded from the ebay selling this has done and partly, selecting stuff for her impending birthday.

In the evening Daddy and Jessica managed to rip up the last of the shed. The floor has now gone and all that is left is an old patio.

I see no sheds

title.value: Jessica Birthday Party, Katie Shopping Trip, Daddy 14 miles runs

info.content:
Joey and Michael came over to join the boys in parkrun at Frimley Lodge. All slow, recovery runs.

David, Yasmin and Reuben came over for a BBQ at lunchtime. The weather just about held. It was good to see Yasmin and Reuben didn't need any warming up and played straight away with us.

For the first time we had to get in our cars and travel up to Deepcut for the annual RLC Day. They had swapped the stalls around this year, but it seemed everything was there, although we were initially worried about the rope over water challenge. Thankfully we spotted it in the opposite corner. We all had our goes on various things. Reuben was loving the big trucks, boats, guns, etc. The girls played around with the diver who got us all wet! The rope challenge was met by all. Jessica even wanted to go on the full stretch rope, but she was deemed too young. The troop even had a go at paintballing. Fantastico.

The normal fairground attractions were there, and the usual go on the popular fun house. Reuben's had never gone on a fast, fairground ride before, so went on the spinning fast cars with Jessica and Ben. He looked liked he was enjoying it, but as soon as it went fast he said 'I want to come off'!! Oh. Still, when he did eventually come off he had a great time.

We returned home and Mummy and Katie had to shoot off to Helen's bbaby shower over in Hempstead village, whilst the rest of us played cricket in the back garden.

Backgarden Football

Army Diver

Gun fight

Famous rope challenge

The fairground ride

Paintballer

Ben was impressed with his paintballing score, but was Yasmin?

title.value: Dixons Army Day, Helens Baby Shower

info.content: Daddy completed the second Yateley 10km of the year in a time of 53 minutes. He was pleased with that.

We found out that Katie had broken her arm in two places, the radial and ulna bones and required a operation. It was not until 2pm that she went to be anaesthetised. She didn't remember going to sleep. The operation took 50 minutes and a cast was put on. She had to stay for a bit. Daddy, Jessica and Ben came to collect Katie and Mummy at about 7:30 in the evening. The last checks were made and we were all exhausted. Katie had a Dominos pizza as a treat.

Broken Arm

Another busy Saturday. Daddy had volunteered to help setup the parkrun so he went off early to the park. In the afternoon we went to the Frimley C of E school fair. We had Â£5 each to spend (waste!!).

Katie meanwhile went on Guide camp last night for the weekend. She went to Ardingly where the scouting movement from Surrey Heath decamped!

She managed to do all the risky activities during the day like abseiling, caving, which she found claustrophobic, rock climbing and 'go ape' and then breaks her arm in the evening falling over a guy rope, twice!! An ambulance was called and two of the guide followed her to East Surrey Hospital in Redhill.

Meanwhile the rest of us were partying on down at Ma Ma and Pop Pop's retirement do in Ma Ma's school in Gravesend. About 11:30 and we got the call, so we rushed over to hospital to find a tired Katie. By all accounts she cried at first and then was very mature and controlled about the whole situation, so said the guide leaders. This did not sound like the Katie we love. She did say that her arm ached a lot. However, we were ever so proud of her.

It was 2:00am on Sunday morning, and we were not getting much progress, so Daddy went home with Jessica and Ben. It was about 3am before they got to bed. Mummy stayed with Katie on the Children's ward.

Jessica singing to the crowds!

title.value: PR, Katie Breaks Arm, Weston Retirement Party, C of E school fair

info.content:
Daddy and Katie made Mummy breakfast in bed. It was the first ever time Katie had made a cup of tea. A job for life I reckon. Anyway, Katie had also made a lot of effort on the banner she made by designing and carefully cutting out letters spelling Happy Birthday and putting them on the front room wall.

Mummy got lots of cards and presents. She got some clothes, a haircut, Dr Pepper, Mint Poppits, Florida book, Walk book, over Â£100 of Next vouchers and flowers.

"Breakfast In Bed"

Ben has been telling us all how he reckons one of his legs is shorter than the other. Of course the rest of the family have been laughing it off. Recently he has been complaining about having hip and knee pains. So mummy took him down the doctors and they agreed with Ben and was referred immediately down to Frimley Park Hospital where he had some Xrays done. That coupled with all the blotches over his legs, the boy is in the wars at the moment. We find out the Xray results in a couple of weeks.

title.value: Ben - Leg shorter than other - Hospital

info.content:
Parkrun in the morning and a cake sale which we made over Â£285 for Cystic Fibrosis.

FF Cake Sale

We had been building up for this event for a while, making sure the back garden is safe for the children, with all the broken wood around. About Â£200 spent on food, drink and BBQ bits.

This BBQ idea has been in the back of Daddy's mind for a few years now, and this is the first opportunity with all the space in the back garden. So we had Phil and Anna Roe, Nick, Martin Aves and Vicky, the Elders (no Joey) and Barrie, Freya and Harry. We were supposed to see Julie and Josh but they were unable to come in the end which was a shame.

The weather was scorching, everything went well. All the children were playing in the paddling pool and trampoline. The funniest bit was when the football came out and the old Casuals magic began to re-appear. Keepu-Upies. Don't think we were ever good at this, but we were really quite bad. Mr Aves surpassed himself and fell not only once into a bush, but twice and headed the ball over the next doors fence. PLUM!

View from the garden

Paddling Pool games

Martin in bush

Good time had by all. The West's stayed over for the night.

Ben on the otherhand went off with the Scouts to some place near Chelmsford for an adventure activity day. He had a great time there. He had a go on some inflatable slides, a wind tunnel, flight and car simulator and grass sledging.

title.value: FF Cake Sale, BBQ, Ben Scout Activity Day

info.content:
Daddy had some nice fathers day presents including a pot of vintage marmite and some ginger beer.

There was still quite a bit to do on the shed in terms of removing the skin and chopping all the wood up for a potential wood burner in the future.

Toby has been in hospital again for most of the week. They still not 100% sure what is wrong with him. He has had a line put in so anti-biotics can be put in him for the next 6 weeks! Anyway we travelled over to Alton and went to see how he was.

Shed dismantled

title.value: Fathers Day, Shed work, Elders Visit

info.content:
A really busy day today. After a disappointing parkrun at Frimley which Daddy did on his own, Daddy had quite a few people interested in the old Honda CB500 which was put on Ebay. Many asked how much I would take for it now. I was surprised to see other bikes go for around Â£400. A chap came around, looked at it for about 2 minutes, and agreed on Â£425. Daddy was pleased.

In the afternoon we went over to Jessica's school fair which was interrupted with some rainy spells. Daddy was on the wobbly bike stall and Mummy on the front desk. We had Â£10 each to spend, which was dispatched quite quickly!

In the evening Daddy's friends came around and they all went off to the pubs of Frimley Green. The event, England's first World Cup game. They were quite optimistic at getting a win against an old Italy. Of course England lost 2-1. Steven, Nick and Barrie all stayed around for the night.

The poor girl goes

title.value: ParkRun, Motorbike Sale, Jessica School Fair, World Cup England

info.content:
Jessica took Daddy into school for a special Fathers Day. Daddy spent time colouring in, playing and reading books with Jessica.... up until lunchtime.

School Day

Monday to Friday this week Katie is on a French trip with school. All but a dozen have gone by Coach and Ferry to Brittany.

Day 1: The whole family got up at 5am and took Katie to the coach. They caught the ferry from Portsmouth. They spent the day in St Malo.

Day 3: Mont St Michael

Day 4: Dinan

On the ferry from Portsmouth

Mont St Michael

Daddy and Farfar did some more work in shed deconstruction in the morning, whilst the rest of us went to church.

After church, we headed straight off to Istead Rise for Iscot, Ma Ma's take on Ascot. It was a BBQ with the Barnett family and a horse racing DVD afternoon with bets. Sadly none of us won the big prize. Auntie Charlotte on the other hand walked away with Â£70!

Watching the Horse Racing

The Elders came over to do the parkrun with Daddy and Ben at Frimley Lodge. The results were amazing. Ben took the lead for most of the two laps, but was pipped at the post by Joey who came in 7 seconds quicker. Ben PB'ed at 24:51. An immense achievement, although he cried I think because that was the first time any of his peers had beaten him. He said he was crying because he was sweating so much, it had no where else to go!

Daddy's motorbike has had it's last days. Yesterday it failed it's MOT by at least Â£550! Front right seal is leaking / weeping, rear brake disc is warped, ball bearings broken, brakes pads replacing, needs a new rear tyre. Basically a lot of work. It comes a time where we need to cut loose.

So Daddy looked online for some bikes. The first to be chosen was a Honda VFR 800 from a dealership in Farnham. Daddy has ridden many other bikes, but he had ridden Michael's VFR 800 6 years ago. Back then he found it a bit heavy and hard to handle. However, now Daddy loved riding it. Such a joy.

So he haggled and bought the bike for Â£2850, just Â£150 off the asking price. Job done. There's no mucking about. Daddy picks the bike up on Wednesday.

The Elders stayed for lunch and then went back home, whilst the girls went shopping in Farnborough for the up and coming French trip, the boys took their peddle bikes and rode along the canal to Deepcut lock, went past our old house, popped in to see Grandma and returned home.

We had Leah over to stay the night, so we watch the Britain's Got Talent Final and a load of girly films afterwards.

title.value: Ben PB parkrun, Elders Over, Bike Ride, New Motorbike, Leah sleepover

info.content:
After church and a yummy Sunday lunch we went over to Lyne and travelled on the Great Cockrow railway with the fars. We had a couple of lovely, long rides. Daddy even treated us to some expensive ice cream. Mmm.

Cockrow Railway

Ben had Jasper over last night for a sleepover. They mainly played Minecraft, although we did play cricket in the back garden last night and Beat the Parents board game.

Katie was on her 5th slepover of the week. This time she was at Nina's with the pre-school gang of girls.
